segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1

segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1

segment.source: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1
segment.target: Release Notes for Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0 SP1

segment.source: To search these release notes, press Ctrl+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press Ctrl+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 SP1.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) 4.0 SP1.

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install AGPM 4.0 SP1 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install AGPM 4.0 SP1 and contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these release notes and other AGPM documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these release notes and other AGPM documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: AGPM 4.0 SP1 known issues
segment.target: AGPM 4.0 SP1 known issues

segment.source: This section contains release notes for AGPM 4.0 SP1.
segment.target: This section contains release notes for AGPM 4.0 SP1.

segment.source: Control Panel’s “Uninstall” tool may not work when you try to change AGPM Server settings
segment.target: Control Panel’s “Uninstall” tool may not work when you try to change AGPM Server settings

segment.source: The tool in Control Panel that lets you uninstall or change a program may not work when you try to change AGPM server settings.
segment.target: The tool in Control Panel that lets you uninstall or change a program may not work when you try to change AGPM server settings.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Before you try to change AGPM server settings by using Control Panel, make a copy of the AGPM Archive folder.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Before you try to change AGPM server settings by using Control Panel, make a copy of the AGPM Archive folder.

segment.source: You can then use Setup.exe to reinstall the AGPM server and choose the configuration parameters that you want.
segment.target: You can then use Setup.exe to reinstall the AGPM server and choose the configuration parameters that you want.

segment.source: Reports do not display the links that were added to a Group Policy Object
segment.target: Reports do not display the links that were added to a Group Policy Object

segment.source: The AGPM settings and difference reports do not display the links that were added to a Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: The AGPM settings and difference reports do not display the links that were added to a Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: WORKAROUND: To view the links in the reports, select the GPO in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and click the Settings tab in the right pane.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: To view the links in the reports, select the GPO in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and click the Settings tab in the right pane.

segment.source: Reports do not display all “Choice Options Properties” settings
segment.target: Reports do not display all “Choice Options Properties” settings

segment.source: The AGPM settings and difference reports do not display all of the settings that were selected on the Choice Options Properties window in the Group Policy Object Editor.
segment.target: The AGPM settings and difference reports do not display all of the settings that were selected on the Choice Options Properties window in the Group Policy Object Editor.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Use the GPMC to view the selected Choice Options Properties settings in the reports.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Use the GPMC to view the selected Choice Options Properties settings in the reports.

segment.source: Reports do not display the Show and Hide tabs in certain browsers
segment.target: Reports do not display the Show and Hide tabs in certain browsers

segment.source: The Show and Hide tabs, shown on the right side of the AGPM settings and difference reports, are not displayed when you view the reports in Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.
segment.target: The Show and Hide tabs, shown on the right side of the AGPM settings and difference reports, are not displayed when you view the reports in Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: View the reports by using Internet Explorer.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: View the reports by using Internet Explorer.

segment.source: AGPM settings and difference reports may show different content from GPMC reports
segment.target: AGPM settings and difference reports may show different content from GPMC reports

segment.source: The AGPM settings and difference reports may not show the same content as reports in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: The AGPM settings and difference reports may not show the same content as reports in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Use the GPMC to view the AGPM reports.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Use the GPMC to view the AGPM reports.

segment.source: AGPM Service does not start if the domain controller is not online
segment.target: AGPM Service does not start if the domain controller is not online

segment.source: When the AGPM Service is installed on a domain controller on Windows 8, the Service does not start if the domain controller is not online.
segment.target: When the AGPM Service is installed on a domain controller on Windows 8, the Service does not start if the domain controller is not online.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Manually start the AGPM Service after the domain controller is online.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Manually start the AGPM Service after the domain controller is online.

segment.source: Upgrade of AGPM Server to AGPM 4.0 SP1 is blocked when you upgrade from the AGPM 4.0 release plus the hotfix
segment.target: Upgrade of AGPM Server to AGPM 4.0 SP1 is blocked when you upgrade from the AGPM 4.0 release plus the hotfix

segment.source: If you try to upgrade the AGPM server to AGPM 4.0.
segment.target: If you try to upgrade the AGPM server to AGPM 4.0.

segment.source: SP1 after installing AGPM 4.0 and then installing the AGPM hotfix (see Knowledge Base article 2643502), the upgrade fails and cannot be completed.
segment.target: SP1 after installing AGPM 4.0 and then installing the AGPM hotfix (see Knowledge Base article 2643502), the upgrade fails and cannot be completed.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Uninstall the AGPM 4.0 Server and then install AGPM 4.0 SP1.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Uninstall the AGPM 4.0 Server and then install AGPM 4.0 SP1.

segment.source: Reports do not display organizational unit links
segment.target: Reports do not display organizational unit links

segment.source: If you link an uncontrolled GPO to an organizational unit and then control that GPO using AGPM, the AGPM settings and difference reports do not display the organizational unit links.
segment.target: If you link an uncontrolled GPO to an organizational unit and then control that GPO using AGPM, the AGPM settings and difference reports do not display the organizational unit links.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: From the Controlled tab of the Change Settings node, right-click the GPO and click Settings and then click GPO Links to view the organizational links.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: From the Controlled tab of the Change Settings node, right-click the GPO and click Settings and then click GPO Links to view the organizational links.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can use the GPMC to view the links to a GPO from the Scope tab.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can use the GPMC to view the links to a GPO from the Scope tab.
